list_definition.definition: an expression used when leaving someone

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Goodbye – it was good of you to visit us
They said their goodbyes and left.

list_ex_of_english: Around fifty people turned up to say good-bye.
To remain emotionally available to our patients we must come to an acceptance of their deaths and learn to say goodbye.
The very last map appears on the penultimate page of the index, almost as if the author cannot bear to say goodbye.
There were concerns about the golden goodbyes that various people were given.
As he waves good-bye, he walks away, into the sunset.
I am delighted to have the opportunity to say goodbye to the community charge, or to the poll tax as it became known.
In contrast, the sophisticated professional investor got out a long time ago and can wave goodbye to the windfall tax.
We said goodbye to over 20,000 paragraphs in the manual required to operate supplementary benefit.
